Austrian Chancellor Karl Niehammer is the newly elected leader of the country's Conservative People's Party. The former interior minister was unanimously voted in at a party conference in Graz on Saturday. Niehammer succeeded Alexander Schallenberg last December after he served just two months in office after former Chancellor Sebastian Kurz stepped down amid a corruption probe.
